that should allow you to add other resolutions to xorg

did you restart xorg?
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart    but be aware that command will close x windows and all apps that depend on x
when x is restarted, it should have the new resolutions available
what I did was CTRL+ALT+F1, add the resolutions, restart xorg, CTRL+ALT+F7 and the new resolutions were there
here are two very good starting points for docs: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/  and  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UserDocumentation
http://ubuntuforums.org/  has also saved my backside more times than I can count
the safe bet is to use something like "sudo appname" for command line apps, and "gksu appname" for gui apps. example: "gksu synaptic"  will open the synaptic gui
